H0.text: Atmospheric nitrogen is low is the condition in which the climate of an area would be expected to have the least temperature fluctuations.

H1.text: Vegetation is sparse is the condition in which the climate of an area would be expected to have the least temperature fluctuations.

H2.text: Days are longest is where the climate of an area would be expected to have the least fluctuations in temperatures.

H3.text: Humidity is high is the condition under which an area's climate is expected to have the least temperature fluctuations.

A4.text: Oceanic climates are accompanied by small annual ranges of temperatures

A5.text: Humid continental climates are marked by large seasonal temperature variance

A6.text: Vegetation typically prospers in oceanic climates

A7.text: Subpolar oceanic climates are less prone to temperature extremes than humid continental climates

A8.text: Bodies with relatively large mass and heat capacity typically exhibit slower temperature responses.
